revised_title: Samuel Taylor Coleridge's Influence on the Appointment of J. F. Daniell as Professor of Chemistry at King's College London
tldr: The article discusses how poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge played a crucial role in the appointment of John Frederic Daniell as the Professor of Chemistry at King's College London in 1831. Coleridge, a friend of Daniell's, used his influence to support Daniell's candidacy, which ultimately led to his successful appointment. Daniell went on to have a significant impact on the field of chemistry and electrochemistry during his tenure at the college.
